meanings.definition: To venture to say or think
meanings.sent1: I daresay the sun will rise tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She daresay that it will rain later.
meanings.sent3: I daresay we'll see a unicorn before that happens.
meanings.sent4: His prediction was so accurate, it was as if he could daresay the future.
meanings.sent5: Even though it seemed impossible, he daresay the impossible.

meanings.definition: To express an opinion or belief
meanings.sent1: I daresay she will win the race.
meanings.sent2: He daresay that chocolate is the best flavor.
meanings.sent3: I daresay the moon is made of cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her words were so powerful, it was as if she could daresay the truth.
meanings.sent5: Despite the odds, he daresay his dreams will come true.

meanings.sent1: I daresay I will ace this test.
meanings.sent2: She daresay that she is the best singer.
meanings.sent3: I daresay I can eat this entire cake in one sitting.
meanings.sent4: His determination was so strong, it was as if he could daresay his success.
meanings.sent5: With unwavering belief, she daresay she will reach the stars.
